description: Smallest prime p having n different cycles in decimal expansions of k/p, k=1..p-1.
references: John H. Conway and R. K. Guy, The Book of Numbers, Copernicus Press, p. 162.
M. Gardner, Mathematical Circus, Cambridge University Press (1996).
links: Robert G. Wilson v, Table of n, a(n) for n = 1..10000 The first 1000 from T. D. Noe.
H. Richter, The period length of the decimal expansion of a fraction
Index entries for sequences related to decimal expansion of 1/n
mathematica: f[n_Integer] := Block[{k = 1, p}, While[p = k*n + 1; ! PrimeQ[p] || p != 1 + n*MultiplicativeOrder[10, p] || GCD[10, p] > 1, k++]; p]; Array[f, 50] (* _Robert G. Wilson v_, Apr 19 2005; revised Aug 20 2014 *)
crossrefs: First time n appears in A006556.
author: _Robert G. Wilson v_, 1994; Antreas P. Hatzipolakis (xpolakis(AT)otenet.gr), May 22 2000
extensions: More terms from _David W. Wilson_, May 22 2000
